intro: Keetia tenuiflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered keetia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Keetia tenuiflora is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
